Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: LaBelleIseult
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay on the Lido as opposed to Venice proper for our second honeymoon. The photos online wer very helpful and we fell in love with one room in particular. I rang the hotel directly to see if we could get that room and Daniele was simply wonderful! I can't say enough about all the hotel staff, from the front desk to the ladies in the breakfast room to the maids. They were all superb! Our room was on the second floor and overlooked the lagoon. We awoke every morning to a beautiful view of Venice. Clean as a whistle, the room was spacious and beautifully appointed. The breakfast was delicious with a selection of fruit, cereals, breads, cheeses, pastries/puddings, juices and coffee as well as freshly scrambled eggs and bacon. The hotel is in a perfect location, just steps from the vaporetto (water taxi) stand that takes you into Venice. A short walk down a lovely street in the opposite direction and you're at the beach. We will definitely be back to Venice one day and will happily stay once again at the Riviera!

Reviews.Title: “unexpectedly very nice”
Reviews.Author: shikhz
Reviews.Content: I liked my stay at Hotel Riviera as i personally felt it was better to stay at Lido island.I think its the only island which has a beach.Esp weekends are nice in Lido.The hotel staff is very nice and the rooms are decent too.I only feel that the curtains should be darker for better sleep.The bar just opposite the hotel is a great fun place,amazing drinks and Italian food.The hotel is right across the ferry terminal so excellent location.The breakfast is a lavish spread considering most other places in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: LD5500
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Riviera for the first 2 nights of a European vacation. We chose the hotel for its value and reviews we had read online. We were quite pleased. Overall, we had three rooms among our family, and each was quite different. Keep that in mind when you're reading reviews. One might have a shower/tub & a balcony, while another might have a tiny shower and smaller windows. Despite the differences in room quality, we paid the same price for each double occupancy room. Also, double occupancy might mean that two twin beds are pushed together, which can be awkwardly uncomfortable, but workable. The front desk staff was wonderful! They were welcoming at check-in, made sure each of our requests was met, and were really knowledgeable when we asked questions about the area. The vaporetto station is directly across the street, so Venice & the surrounding islands were all very accessible. The hotel did tell us that they have a private boat that runs to Venice & Murano every morning, and I believe they said it was complimentary (check on that, though). We found the vaporetto to be best for our needs. Caution: The vaporetto stop running around midnight, so plan accordingly. We loved our evenings on the island. Being from Southern California, it reminded us of Catalina Island. It's a bit quiet and quite lovely. The food and limited shopping are very touristy. The bike rentals looked really fun! Mid-May was too cold for the beach, but we did walk to the other side of the island to check it out. Nice walk, and it's probably a great spot in the summer. The best part of the hotel was the breakfast! An amazing spread of pastries, cheeses, cereals, fruits, juices & coffee were set out for the guests every morning in a large sunroom with a view out to the street and the water. Just wonderful. :-) If you're being a bit budget-conscious on your trip to Venice, this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: kitwalker_devil
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 day stay in Italy and I stayed at this hotel based on a friends recommendation. The hotel room was nice and large - much like the American/Australian hotels that you would be used to. Right across the road from the water ferries and a short walk to a small supermarket for your supplies. A good variety of breakfast in the morning which always starts your day off really well! Overall a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A little Haunting?”
Reviews.Author: Katy B
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with a bunch of friends around Italy, we stayed in this hotel July 17-19. Short visit. All of it was great, my friend and I had a big room (for Europe) and it was on the one of the lower floors, maybe 3rd or 4th. Everything was great and the staff was very friendly. The only complaint i would have is that I was waiting for my friend to take a shower so we could join everyone else for breakfast. So i was waiting on her bed and I could hear her "singing" in the shower. Then, the bathroom doorknob started to turn, tried to get like...yanked open, then whatever it was let go and the doorknob snapped back. I asked Aryhanna if she had tried to open the door the second after it had happened and she said no. I was a little thrown off by the experience, because the night before i heard our windows open and then slam shut, I got up and then closed them and went back asleep thinking nothing of it. Then in the morning the latch was broken and the windows were open again. Me being a teenage girl I think this was a cool experience but I also wanted to know if any of y'all have experienced this as well?

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel with lots of character”
Reviews.Author: ungerhausen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there many times. The rooms are nicely furnished with antiques. The breakfast is very good ( hot and cold), the location is great, right across from the Vaporetto Pier.Reception is manned with very friendly multy lingual personnel. Service is outstandig.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the city, great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Rich P
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two friends in October 2010 for three nights. The room was clean, but per usual the bathroom was pretty small. You'll have to take a water taxi over to the hotel, which can be a pain if you have a lot of luggage, but the price makes up for that. Others have said it was expensive, but relative to other hotels in the Venice area it was cheaper. Since it's an island right off the mainland of Venice, you have a beautiful view of the city at night. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but nice, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Besanc0n
Reviews.Content: (Please forgive the wrong travel dates above) I stayed in Hotel Riviera on 12th Sep 2009 for 1 night only, in a single room (bf incl) for EUR100 per night. Honestly it was a bit pricey but I was on an official visit, otherwise I would not have paid so much as it is over my budget limit. Pros: "Beautiful location" - right infront of the vaporetto pier, at the corner of the main and most beautifl street in Lido with many eateries and pleasant shops. It was such a change from the crowds of main venice to see the people calmly sipping coffee and kids playing around. Very peaceful. Also did not get chance to use the sun deck/patio on terrace at top floor (EUR 10 / chair) "Great Buffet Breakfast" - Choices of bakery items, yougurts, fruits, cereals and what not! Its a feast! "Nice decor" - Nice touch of victorian era, furniture and chandeliers. Cons; "Rooms and baths very small" - for the price, quite small. Bed was also small and a bit hard. "bit Pricey" - as mentioned earlier, but bear in mind that Venice is very expensive and this rate might be justified but the rate certainly not for backpackers. CONCLUSION: Clearly the Pros outweigh the Cons and Lido is a peaceful and beautiful island that you will enjoy. So don't worry and go for it. I recommend it if it fits your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great to get out of the city after a day of sight seeing!”
Reviews.Author: tashaust
Reviews.Content: We were staying in Venice for 3 days and 4 nights and after much investigation chose the Riviera hotel. This ended up being the best part of our 5 week holiday (not just because we got engaged in Venice) but also because the location was just perfect for us. The water bus stop was just across the road, which was very convenient and there were water bus's every 10 mins if not more. After a tiring day of sight seeing, we just popped back to our hotel and rested, and then hopped over to Venice again for dinner. But if you do not want to do that, there are heaps of places to eat in Lido and it was much cheaper than eating in Venice. The room was absolutely fantastic! We had the room with the balcony, which looked over St Marks square and I got a stunning photo of the sun setting. The breakfast was great and coffee pots were supplied on each table (upon request). All in all a great hotel and would love to return when we visit Venice again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big breakfast but very uncomfortable bed and church bells right outside our window”
Reviews.Author: Gobnat
Reviews.Content: When you go on these sightseeing trips you sleep and shower in your hotel room. After a long day of sightseeing you just want to collapse into a comfortable bed...not a concrete slab that they wouldn't make a prisoner sleep on! We were both very tired during our whole time in venice. I would also agree with other comments that the air con was very loud. When we went to check in we were told our room wasn't ready and to come back in an hour. We were slightly annoyed as we only had 48 precious hours in venice but we decided to go get some lunch down the street. We came back in an hour and were told that our room still wasn't ready. If I hadn't kicked up a fuss the concierge wouldn't have rang to check and wouldn't have realised that he was looking at the wrong reservation and the wrong room number...so we wasted an hour sitting around for no reason. There were two people behind the reception desk yet they were only booking one person in at a time...something I thought was very odd and unneccessary. We were also so that our room had a sea view.... when we openend our window you could see the view if you stodd on tip toe and tilted your head. The church bells ringing at 8:15am every morning didn't improve our mood either. If it wasn't for the great breakfast (even if it was a bit weird that they served chocolate swiss roll at breakfast) and the location right next to the vaparetto stop I think I would have tried to find a different hotel. It was cheap for venice though and if you are on a tight budget, like we were...it's probably one of the nicer ones around. I guess with enough glasses of vino in you you would be able to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel, Love the Lido”
Reviews.Author: aegpres
Reviews.Content: Overall we liked this hotel and it was about want others had said on TA. We also had no issues with staying on the Lido instead of in Venice. The water bus service is outstanding and runs 24x7 so you really are connected just about anywhere in the Venice area including on the Lido. The hotel is also located directly across from the water bus station which makes it very very easy to travel back and forth from Venice. The hotel staff was very friendly, professional and helpful. The rooms are large and clean. For the most part, our only issues were the normal Europe hotel issues - small bathrooms and showers, small elevator, etc but, also I am not sure you could buy a smaller TV for a hotel room then they have here, not that we did much TV time so really not a big issue but wow that was a small one. Oh and Wi-Fi while it was at the hotel for use it came with a fee and didn't work in our rooms. Since we run a business back in the US that requires us to stay connected online this did create a few problems and added costs. There was one other issue, others had mentioned that the hotel had a space at the beach for use in the private beach area. We asked the hotel desk about it and they get a coupon to use, they gave us directions to the location and we packed up and walked down to the beach excited about a day at the beach, but when we got there we learned it was closed for the winter, so we rolled with it and just did the public beach, but since we didn't have towels, umbrella, drinks, etc (which was all part of the private beach deal) it just wasn't the same. When we returned to the hotel and let them know it was closed they seemed surprised. Just be aware that if you plan a beach day be sure the private beach area is even open. This is a nice hotel and we would stay there again and would have given the them five stars but with all the combined (small) issues a 4 seems about right.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rouzbeh
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel. Very friendly staffs. Good breakfast. Best location. Very beautiful balcony. But the internet was too slow and too expensive. Also, the TV was too small and old fashioned. The air conditioner was too noisy.

Reviews.Title: “best value for money”
Reviews.Author: paklons
Reviews.Content: i was in venice for the biennale alone and hotel riviera was a fantastic place to be: friendly personnel, close to the vaparetto (10 minutes to san marco), small single room, but for the price..., unbeatable in venice what value for money concerns...

Reviews.Title: “fantastic and affordable way to visit venice”
Reviews.Author: Lucy H
Reviews.Content: Hotel Riviera was a fantastic hotel. The room was clean and the bathroom reasonably new. It offered a free buffet breakfast which had a lot on offer. The best part of the hotel was its accessibility. Based right next to the vaporetto stop, you can get in to venice in less than 15mins and the water buses come every 10 minutes, nice and easy and yet stay away from the chaos and prices in Venice itself. Also if you ask the receptionist bright and early, the hotel reserves a certain number of free sun beds and parasols on a private beach just up the road for free when it would normally cost 35â‚¬ and even offers a free trip to a glass factory in murano which was one of favourite parts of our trip. The hotel offers a lot for its rates. Great value for money. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great View! Great Room!”
Reviews.Author: Ric56
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was very nice,taxi boat station across the street.We had great view from our room. The staff was great,free breakfast included.short walk to the beach

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: cagioiosa
Reviews.Content: My partner and myself just spent a Sunday night at LA Riviera in room 39 which had two windows offering amazing views of the Lagoon across to St Marks Square. The room was Venetian style, clean and functional. The lounge was kitch but comfortable and breakfast was very good. For 95 euros it was money well spent!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value - Venice Lido is the way to go!”
Reviews.Author: cwelsh12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in May as part of a trip across Europe. We found that prices on Lido were much more affordable than Venice proper and boy were we happy with our decision. Lido is a wonderful island with fantastic beaches within walking distance of the hotel. We found that after touring Venice it was great to come back to this area, lots of residential neighborhoods around so you get the feeling like you're really living the Italian life as you stroll up and down the streets. The main drag (which conveniently, the hotel is located on) is more touristy with shops selling beachwear and some decent english speaking restaurants that stay open late. The hotel is literally right across the street from the Vaporetto station, so from there we were able to visit Burano and Murano (don't miss them, both interesting and you can see both in an afternoon). The hotel itself is nice with friendly service and spacious rooms by European standards. High ceilings and the bed was two twins pushed together but we encountered that several times in different locations.There are shutters on the windows that make it literally pitch black inside the room, which is great if you are jet lagged. There is a lovely sun terrace that you can use, great for grabbing a bottle of wine and sitting out to watch the world go by. If you found it noisy - its because its in a bustling area, not a country setting. We loved sitting and taking everything in. Peaceful at night. Breakfast is european continental and has everything you need to start your day. For the amount that we paid for this hotel, the value was outstanding. It's not a five-star hotel, but it went well beyond our expectations for the price we paid to stay in Venice. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not most welcoming at front of house.”
Reviews.Author: gillyPortadown
Reviews.Content: Great location to stay while visiting Venice. Super beaches but make sure you walk away from public beach at end of road. Beach is miles long with shallow entry into sea. Very easy to find from waterbus and good location to enjoy peace and quite away from Venice especially at night. On arrival staff very quickly checked us in but did not offer any advice regarding hotel and facilities - only found sun terrace and balcony by exploring ourselves and sharing with other guests.

Reviews.Title: “perfection on the venitian riviera”
Reviews.Author: twhengineer
Reviews.Content: just returned from venice after a short break with a copuple of friends all booked into the riveria for 4 nights. The staff were excellent and very helpful 24 hours a day. The rooms were sumptious by venice standards . we stayed in the lagoon view room whilst friends stayed in a above standard room on the second floor, but had too toss a coin to see which was the more expensive room! both were light and airy with high ceilings and a world away from the small rooms we had experienced in venice city and half as expensive!. the lagoon view was fabulous and we had the joy of watching a fantastic thunderstorm lighting up venice during the night from the small bal;cony off our room. They have an area of open terrace at first floor level were you can watch the sunset over the lagoon a sip an ice cold beer or g & T. Memorable times and great little hotel. Only gripe, no bar but they provide all drinks to terrace and Bus station / vaparetto stop can be a litttle noisy on a night but then we were only 10 mins from St Marks and the ride out to the lido was always pleasant. lido is much quieter and provides all the needs of a weary walker after a full day of culture. Would stay again with out hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: bvnathan
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here while hanging out in Venice. Lido is a few stops away from all the main sights, but much less tourist traffic. The hotel is located right next to the boat stop. Our room was very elegant, and for the price we paid (65 Euros, through booking.com) was excellent! Didn't care much for any of the nearby restaurants, though, and I'd encourage people to avoid them if possible. Most of them serve pre-frozen meals at high prices. Better to rely on the restaurants on the main island.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel would thoroughly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Mc57
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, lovely rooms friendly staff and very clean. Would totally recommend this hotel and the lido for a relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but charming”
Reviews.Author: Italychaperone
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our group of high schoolers for two nights. The hotel really makes an effort to be inviting and we appreciated it. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and nice (especially for Venetians). The bathrooms are really tiny and it was nearly impossible to take a shower in the little area that is enclosed by merely a clingy curtain, and not flood the entire floor of the bathroom. If you can, get a room that has a tub as well as a shower. The breakfast was quite good with a variety of foods. The cappucini are real and not instant and the serving staff were very polite. The location is excellent. It was right next to the vaporetto (sp?) - the boat that takes you to Venice. My room was right across from the boat stop and on the first night of Carnivale, many inebriated revelers got off right there making for a very noisy night, but I am sure that is not the case every night. I would stay there again, but ask for the bigger bathroom to avoid the flood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: jnikjnik
Reviews.Content: During a three night stay in Venice, booked this for the 3rd night as a bit of a cross-lagoon adventure, and to save some cash (about half the price we paid for the "city" hotel). Booked the Lagoon View room which was well worth it! After a short boat trip, you are treated to the spectacular views of the lagoon and Venice from not at all far. The room size was good. Clean - both the room and the bathroom. Comfortable sleep, the bus terminal stop below get a bit noisy, but it quietens down for the night. The styling of the room is on the old-fashioned side, but since you're either sleeping or admiring the view, it's not bother. The staff are helpful and the breakfast is good for this part of the world. Overall: well worthy a recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, great value!”
Reviews.Author: cdrover
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here on a budget. The Hotel is located right next to the water bus station on Lido Island which was convenient! There were a couple of nice Italian Restaurants nearby, and the ride to St Marks Square was about 5-10minutes. The staff were extremely helpful, and the lobby was nicely decorated. Our room was very cute - again, nicely decorated and a very comfortable bed! The buffet breakfast was great, too! Great value!

Reviews.Title: “I agree with all the great reviews of this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Fuchsia
Reviews.Content: Everyone else has covered all the great points on this hotel so it leaves me little to say except that I endorse them. The hotel is sumptious in character and decoration. It makes a pleasant change from the minimalist decor in more modern hotels. The only flaw was the noise from the traffic. We had a superb room - with a view - on the second floor and although there are shutters on the windows, I must say the noise did distract. Other than that we really enjoyed our stay and the room was one of the better shaped/designed/laid out rooms we've ever stayed in. The local restaurants do offer good value and quite tasty food. We were astounded to buy a 1.5 litre of water in the local supermarket for the princely sum of twenty cent! I spelt it out lest you thought I made a typo!

Reviews.Title: “I'd definately go back”
Reviews.Author: jassyblue80
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Riviera on the Lido in Venice at the end of October. The hotel was easy to find, straight off the number 51 water bus, which you get right outside the train station. We stayed for 3 days so it cost us 33 Euroâ€™s each for a 72 hour pass, however this was something that we were going to need anyway, so wasnâ€™t really an inconvenience, but if you wasnâ€™t planning on jumping on and off the water bus then you might want to add this cost in to the total cost of the hotel? The hotel is very spacious, you receive a friendly welcome on arrival, and when we got to the room we were pleasantly surprised at the size of the room. As it was quite cold we didnâ€™t make much use of the lagoon view I had paid for, however I can imagine it being fantastic in the summer. The only down side to having this view is that in-between the hotel and the water is a road and a bus stationâ€¦ and this is where the only down side for me was, the noise off of the buses and cars. This did disturb my sleep a little, however I am a very light sleeper and it wasnâ€™t very noisy just a little back ground noise really, my wife didnâ€™t really notice. The pluses far out way this little negative, as the hotel is clean, tidy and the Lido offers some reasonably priced restaurants and bars near by. Breakfast is good (as good as continental breakfasts can be lol) There is a TV in each room if you need itâ€¦ but being in Venice I donâ€™t you will have time to watch it. Wi fi is available at a cost (if you need it) and there is a sauna. I would definitely return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Beauty and Generous Hospitality Wrapped Up In Elegance”
Reviews.Author: Sparpook
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel that was easy to get to Venice. The hotel was elegant... with an amazing breakfast to start the day. The front desk was very helpful most of the time. They offered a free tour of the glass factory on Murano which was actually a bit of a waste of time. The "tour" was actually a high end glass shop that offered overpriced glass (in the 100's and 1000's of Euros) we wasted our morning waiting for the water taxi that was supposed to pick us up at the lobby and so we ended up leaving at 11am and wasted a morning when we could have gotten on the water bus and went over ourselves. The vaporatto is right across the street so that was very nice and it was a short ride over to Venice. It was a quiet location and there were some good restaurants nearby. The family room was great and we were thrilled with that... and my other members of the family had a room with a view from the lagoon... it was also nicely appointed rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good the second time around.”
Reviews.Author: Patch69
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Hotel Riviera in June 2009, though friends who should have been with us were unable to come due to family circumstances. So, we returned to Venice this year with our friends and took along another couple for good measure. We had been impressed with the Riviera last year for a number of reasons (overall quality - location - the view across the lagoon of the Venice skyline - from our balcony, watching cruise liners as they eased through the lagoon approaching and leaving Venice), so we suggested staying there again this year. Though our friends were happy to take at face value what we said about the Riviera, we were nevertheless a little anxious that we might have oversold the hotel and that they (almost inevitably) would be disappointed. We hadn't - and they weren't. We had three adjacent double rooms on the first floor each with its own terrace (that we had noticed last year) and after a hard hot day tramping around Venice or the Lido, it was a decadent pleasure to be able to sit out on our terrace and watch the sun set over Venice. Gin and tonic or Campari and tonic within easy reach. Natch. (Personally I prefer the Lido to Venice itself. Sacrelige, I know!) What else is there to say! This is the best three star hotel I have ever stayed in and I can't imagine why it's classified as "only" three star. Breakfast is good and as substantial as you want. I should make clear that we never had an evening meal at the hotel, preferring to seek out a new restaurant to dine at each evening during our 10-day stay. Getting to Venice by water bus is a doddle (and an added pleasure), as the water bus landing stage is just across the street from the hotel. (It's a minor irritation that a new landing stage is being built just opposite the hotel but that's not the hotel's fault - and it doesn't block the view of the Venice skyline. Perhaps if the well appointed and maintained bedrooms were bigger or the TV larger (never had it on) the hotel might aspire to four star status. For what it's worth, in my opinion this is a four star hotel masquerading as a three star hotel. If you don't want to stay in Venice itself but instead want to feel a lagoon breeze on your face while getting to and from Venice then stay on The Lido - at the Riviera. One final pointer for culture vultures and beach lovers. As I've said, it's easy to get to and from Venice by water bus - but a short walk from the hotel also takes you to the shores of the Adriatic. The hotel "owns" two sunbeds with parasols on the private beach and these are available to guests at no charge. Enjoy a day on the beach - a day in Venice., but you do have to book early on the day you want the sunbeds to be sure of getting them.

Reviews.Title: “Keep your eye on the big picture in this great location.”
Reviews.Author: Barnabee797
Reviews.Content: The lagoon view rooms command a terrific view of Venice on the other side of the water and the biggest balconies are on the 1st. floor. The hotel could hardly be more convenient for the vaporetto stop and the service to the mainland is excellent as well as great value when you buy a 3 day or 7 day pass. The Riviera was built as the Hotel Ortellanato (spelling?) about 120 years ago for the fashionable middle class who made the Lido Italy's resort of choice so there is still an air of faded grandeur here rather than the minimalist makeover currently in vogue. On the Gran Viale that leads you straight from the hotel to the Adriatic coast is every kind of facility you would expect in a busy resort as well as a lot of traffic, so if noise at night bothers you ask for a room on the 4th. floor. The Riviera's prix compris breakfast is better than most, although action on the rather tasteless and possibly caffeine-free coffee, the over-diluted orange juice and the tired fruit would improve it considerably. I believe that the key to excellence in every type of business is "attention to detail", so if these minor failings( and other things such as air conditioning blowing cold but not warm, very limited drawer space, dressing table lights with no operating switch, a room safe that cannot be locked and isn't even fixed to anything) bother you, then book somewhere else. For the big things:great position, meticulous cleanliness, spacious rooms( well,ours was), comfortable beds, efficient showers,and helpful reception staff the Riviera can be recommended and we will seriously consider returning there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: tonyw1uk
Reviews.Content: Very good value hotel booked through expedia. We paid slightly more for a terrace room overlooking the lagoon which was SO worth it. Comfortable room, friendly staff, fantastic view and complimentary breakfast. Our first time in Venice, flying into Treviso. Coming off the train from Treviso straight into the madness of Venice was breathtaking. Immediately out of the station on to the vaporetto, then to Lido was just brilliant. Twenty minute journey with spectacular city views. Recommended to all - - -city AND hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: xxoocookies
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to the Water Bus. Felt very safe walking at night / early morning. Close to a lot of restaurants and shopping. The lagoon view room had a great outside patio. We were able to watch the Cruise ships coming in Early Sat Morning.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic views from bedroom”
Reviews.Author: genuine45
Reviews.Content: stayed here in august as last minute holiday. Staff were all very professional and friendly, we had room with fantastic view ov venice across lagoon. breakfast very good choice of fresh fruits, croisants, rolls, yogurts cold meats ect (too many to list). Our room was cleaned and bed linen every day. very central to shops fab beaches 10 minutes walk. vaporetti to venice and islands right opposite hotel every few minutes ans buses.Throughly enjoyed our stay. Good food nearby.

Reviews.Title: “just couldn't sleep”
Reviews.Author: SouthjerseyCraig
Reviews.Content: I was unable to get to sleep or, when I did doze off, stay asleep. It might have been the narrow single bed I was given. Nor was I enthusiastic about the location. There's not much on Lido, and of course you need the vaporetto to get anywhere. If I go back, I think I'd prefer a hotel in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “a gem of a place”
Reviews.Author: taiteys
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated on the Lido with easy access to Venice. Ask for a room with a terrace overlooking the lagoon. The beach is 5 mins walk away and there are numerous restaurants nearby but avoid "tourist menus" - they are dire so be prepared to pay a bit more. The hotel itself is clean and well loooked after and the staff are excellent, a lovely place to stay. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned...but handy!”
Reviews.Author: DaisyDaysMeath
Reviews.Content: Hotel Riviera is not on "mainland" Venice but on Lido. It's well positioned being just over the road from the water bus into Venice itself which is a plus if you want a bit of peace and quiet to relax after a day's walking and sightseeing in Venice proper. The hotel itself is a throw back to the 1950/60's. While the rooms are on the small side (book a room with a balcony and view of the Lagoon if you can) the beds are comfy and breakfasts are more than adequate. I stayed in a room to the front of the hotel but didn't find that noise was a problem. The hotel Bar is no more than a small bar counter, a few bar stools and, more often than not, unattended. There is also a small shop attached to the hotel selling masks, local crafts and postcards. I'd recommend this hotel if you want reasonable price and reasonable accessibility ... without paying Venice prices.

Reviews.Title: “The Riviera on the Lido overlooking Venice”
Reviews.Author: daveandjaneLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Having researched hotels in Venice I was drawn closer to the prospect of the Lido, a 5 minute water bus awya from the main St Marks square. I was not disappointed. The Riviera stands just aside the water bus stop on the Lido, access could not be simpler (24hrs by public bus). I asked for a room with view of Venice and got one. Inside this hotels tries to be elegant and for the most part it succeeds well. Public areas are relaxing and clean. Decor very good, too. Staff are polite and competent. The Hotel does not have many facilities, however there is a balcony on the first floor where one can relax in the sun and watch the world go by on the waterways, cruise liners to barges and gondelas. I felt I did not want to be in an enclosed rundown hotel in the centre with no room to swing a cat. The Riviera was a great choice and the Lido (having a short walk to the beach (350m) offered space, light and elegance that I do not think I would have got for twice the cost in Venice centre.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: Espedair
Reviews.Content: This very pleasant and welcoming hotel, just beside the Lido vaporetto stop for Venice was an ideal spot for a few days chill-out and stroll around Venice. The ample and varied breakfast was an ideal start. The kitchen staff were pleasant and helpful, and remembered our preferences although as in many continental hotels, getting tea and coffee hot enough for Irish preferences took a little effort. The room was a reasonable size, clean and quiet. Hanging space was a bit limited for two people for a week (bring your own hangers) and we were disappointed not to have had a bath. In the evening it was lovely to get away from the congestion of Venice and stroll along the Lido. The room price was excellent and much better than we would have got in Venice itself. We thoroughly enjoyed it and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: daniellesichta
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel and food. good location. the best hotel i stayed at in italy. waling distance from all major boats to access st. marks square. would definately go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loads of charm - a real joy”
Reviews.Author: halwimsey
Reviews.Content: The Riviera is exactly the kind of hotel that we love - laden with character and slightly frayed around the edges. Add to this the views stretching across the lagoon from one of the nicest rooms we've stayed in, and the Riviera was a highlight of our trip. To be fair, we were extremely lucky with the price and the room. I managed to fluke a deal through the hotel's website for a lagoon view room for two nights for 65 euros per night - this in September, when most places were charging well into the hundreds of euros for a similar thing - and put in a request with my booking for a balcony (I thought it was worth a try!). To our delight, we were given a corner "junior suite" (as it was described on the back of the door), with French doors opening to a wraparound balcony and views across the water to San Marco. Couldn't have been better. The furnishings were comfortable and old-fashioned in a good way; we even had an overstuffed armchair that caught the sun and which I would have loved to have stashed into my suitcase and lugged home. The bed was a little on the firm side, but not enough to make sleeping an issue. The busy intersection outside didn't bother us either. We spent a lot of time on the balcony, watching the cruise ships and people and buses and smaller boats come and go. The bathroom was large and clean, with a shower over a bath - the only thing was that there was no shower curtain or screen so, despite our best efforts to prevent it, water tended to flood the floor in front of the basin. Always mopped up and dry when we returned to the room after sightseeing, though. Breakfast was plentiful and served on classic crockery, complete with the hotel logo on it (silly I know, but I'm a sucker for this kind of thing). There were pleasant places to sit if we had wanted to do so, but we had such a great room that we stayed in it whenever we were at the hotel. Public areas were generally a little florid in their decoration, but that's what we liked about the place - at times we felt like we'd stepped into a 1950s film set, it had such a sense of nostalgia about it. There have been some comments about the unfriendliness of staff and I have to admit that we had a mixed bag there. The Sunday/Monday receptionist was kind and helpful - we couldn't fault him - as were the breakfast ladies; the Tuesday morning receptionist was, well, rude and arrogant. No other words for him, really. But that didn't ruin our stay. We've been to Venice numerous times but had never stayed on the Lido before and we found that we enjoyed the location. It wouldn't be for everyone, what with the trek out and back on the vaporetto to the main sights, but it suited us as being a change from our usual Dorsoduro/San Polo routine. As someone else has said, the hop across the lagoon provided a leisurely start and end to the day, time to enjoy the cool breeze and collect our thoughts. We live in deeply rural surroundings, so a trip on a boat is a welcome diversion! If I were a first-time visitor to Venice, I would probably rather stay closer in, but for repeat travellers, it makes for a pleasant enough change. The only thing I would say is that dining options on the Lido are pretty ordinary, with run-of-the-mill places serving even more uninspiring and overpriced food than we've usually found in Venice (which is saying something). We caught a bus way down to the southern end of the island and there seemed to be some better options there - most of them shut on a Monday night, as we discovered when we tried to head back there for dinner the next day. Not really an issue though - we just jumped on to a vaporetto and headed back into central Venice to eat. I can understand that the Riviera is not everyone's type of hotel and that others have had less than desirable stays there; I imagine that a lot hinges on the room that you get and the price that you pay (and we certainly hit the jackpot on both counts). But it was lovely for us - a charming and traditional hotel experience, exactly what we wanted, and we enjoyed it immensely.

Reviews.Title: “Third Time and still wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jessybobs
Reviews.Content: It is obvious that I love this hotel, stayed in June, Sept and Oct 2009, this time I returned with my mum and friends, everything was once again excellent. I was worried the others may not like it but they were very impressed. We paid a bit more this time for a superior room, and had a balcony facing the street with a side view of the lagoon. Excellent location for vaporetto stop. Because we were on the front it was a little noisier ( I stayed at the back the last 2 occasions) Breakfast was once again excellent, and breakfast staff courteous, I found the cappuccini excellent. I cannot understand the bad reviews of this hotel, as I have stayed in both budget and superior rooms, and been pleased with them.. Most of the reception staff are very nice, especially the nightshift receptionist, he was very pleasant and helpful. I can highly reccommend the Hotel Riviera and I'm certain I will be back again. I did notice the Lido is getting more expensive, prices are not much different to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “an oasis away from the maddening crowd”
Reviews.Author: Geoff024
Reviews.Content: Positioned a stone's throw from the Lido vaporettpo stop this was the ideal position to see Venice from. involving only a short trip to St Marks.Hotel is a throwback to another age with some truly old fashioned decor but with lots of old fashioned courtesy and service which was much appreciated.We were initially placed in a smallish room but were offered a larger room after the first night.Although the room seemed fine to us ,having experienced much smaller rooms in other parts of Italy, the new room was very roomy and rather lovely with a view of Venice over the water.Breakfast was one of the best we experienced in Italy.After a day exploring Venice it was so relaxing and pleasant to arrive back at Lido and the Hotel Riviera in particular.Lots of good eating places around the hotel area with much more reasonable prices than on the main island .Highly reccommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it - poor location, tiny rooms and bad service”
Reviews.Author: agaurav
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Italy from USA in Aug 2009 and visited Venice after Rome. We were very disappointed with this hotel. It was our mistake to not do our groundwork about the location. The hotel is on the Lido island - not the main Venice area so we spent quite some time taking the vaporetta to and from Venice to Lido. The hotel itself is situated 3 min walk from the ferry stop though. The two big negatives I faced were - the staff is unfriendly and the rooms are tiny. Rooms being small was expected but they are laid out in a strange manner and the two tiny beds (maybe 2.5 feet wide and 5.5 feet tall) are on two separate walls. Now, that was a first for us. This would probably suit some backpack travelers or something but didn't suit us - husband, wife, 6 year old and 1 year old. The bathroom was just about OK. The staff was extremely rude - I never saw a smile on their face and they were really out there to help us with anything, like directions or questions about the room or possibility to change to a bigger room etc. Breakfast was OK though. Nothing great but fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great value if you're short”
Reviews.Author: PeterH12
Reviews.Content: The Riviera Hotel has much to recommend it. It's comparatively inexpensive and very well located just across the street from the Lido vaporetto stop, for a quick ride in to Venice. The Hotel itself is fairly average, as is the service, but the breakfast buffÃ© is excellent value. If you turn left out the front door and walk the length of the street across the island you'll find a large public beach, of very average quality, but then you did not come to Venice to bathe, did you? As for the surroundings, well, Lido is were you sleep during your stay and nothing much else. Soo, to the room. If you request a single room you must be prepared for it to be small, and I was, and it was. Not to small though and the en-suite bathroom was almost as big. Everything was reasonably clean and whole and there was functioning air-con and tv. So far so good, right? Now we come to my single gripe, but it's a major one. The bed. The most basic function of a hotel is as a place for sleepng in and a decent bed is a must. Now, I am 189 cm (6.2 ft) which is tall but not exceptionally so. The bed was not much longer and the mattress quite a bit shorter, and also fairly hard. I inquired about switching to another room at the front desk but was told that the beds are of a standard size. I had to accept this and did not have the opportunity to confirm it. I stayed five nights and did not sleep well. To conclude, this hotel met all my requirements, except the most basic one. So if you are a bit shorter than me, then go for it, otherwise be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at this hotel was a horrible experience, and it ruined our vacation.”
Reviews.Author: brookeyboo09
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights with my significant other. I am not a picky person when it comes to hotels. I like a clean room and a hotel that provides the amenities that are listed by hotwire and the hotel website. For starters the hotel is definitely not for couples wishing to get away for a romantic weekend. We had a room with two twin beds pushed together that would not stay together. The air conditioning was on high and the room would not drop below 80 degrees. Next, I went to use the internet and the Wi-Fi did not reach our room. Even if it did work I would say that the cost was too high at 6 Euros for a half an hour of use. After my shower in the morning I went to blow dry my hair with the hotel provided dryer and the hair dryer died after about two minutes. In the morning there was a nice breakfast provided, which is the only positive thing I have to say about this hotel. The hotel has a nice sign on their front desk that states â€œa free private ride and tourâ€� on the island of Murano. All you have to do is tell the front desk what time you want to go. When we asked them about this offer they said that they could not get a hold of their boat company. (We waited for over an hour to get any sort of response from the front desk). After touring Venice all day we came back to the room for a rest and shower before dinner. There was a loud noise in the bathroom and I went in to check on it and the shower door had shattered without anyone in there. I went down to the front desk to tell them what happened so hopefully we could change rooms. They said that they would figure something out and take care of it. So, on that note we went out to dinner dirty, but hopeful that things would be worked out by the time we got back. When we returned we went to the front desk, and they blamed us for everything and it was â€œnot their problem to give us another room.â€� I was mad at their lack of helping us but I asked at the very least could they send someone up to clean up the glass so it would be safe to go to the bathroom. Again their response was â€œItâ€™s not our problem.â€� Unbelievable. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff is the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Riviera”
Reviews.Author: Catlady29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Riviera for a week in July 2009 and really loved the hotel! We paid approximately 60 euros per night for a double room which was excellent value for money. We chose not to pay extra for the lagoon view but you could still see the sea from our room. The rooms are not luxurious but very cozy and clean. The bathroom is big enough and also has a bathtub. Breakfast really exceeded our expectations because it had a lot of variety. There were plenty of fresh fruits, berries, pastries, yoghourts, cereals, cheese, ham, jams, cookies, juice, tea, coffee etc. I'd say one of the best hotel breakfasts I've had, definitely in a 3 star hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful and you could see that it's a small hotel because the same ladies who cleaned the rooms also worked as waitresses at breakfast. I noticed that in Venice people in customer service were quite often rude even though we tried to be friendly, which made us appreciate the hotel staff even more. The location of hotel Riviera is really convenient, right next to the vaporetto stop. Personally I wouldn't have stayed in central Venice even though it had been cheaper because it was really crowded with tourists. Of course there were tourists in Lido as well but not nearly as much as in the centre. And in Lido you can also enjoy the beaches and the hotel has its own beach umbrellas which guests can use for free. If we ever return to Venice we will definitely stay at Hotel Riviera!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Average Location”
Reviews.Author: AussieFemale35
Reviews.Content: This hotel was good value for money and positioned overlooking the 'lagoon' and opposite a Vaporetto stop, which made transport into central Venice very easy. However, as we discovered on the last morning, the vaporetto can be quite slow and if you have a train to catch you will need to catch the boat 1.5 - 2hrs beforehand to be absolutely safe... In retrospect it probably would have been better to pay the E10 extra to be located in central Venice for us. Lido is a little holiday suburb overlooking a sub-standard beach (by Australian standards). It does, however, appear to be a popular destination for international travellers. I would recommend it for people who want to stay in Venice long term cheaply, and don't want to be in central Venice. I would not recommend it for people only visiting for two days. The rooms and service and particularly the breakfast were all excellent. No complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “comfy stay”
Reviews.Author: GigCoyle
Reviews.Content: Hi, we stayed at the Riviera for two nights, a Friday and Saturday. The room was very nice, quite large (although the bathroom was quite compact), clean and tidy with a comfy bed. The view from the balcony over to Venice was lovely even though we had a small crane right in front of the window. The road is quite busy in front of the hotel, with water buses and buses coming in as well as a new quay they are building for the water buses. However our room was very quiet the the buidling work, which continued at the weekend. didn't bother us at all. The break fast was fine with a good selection of the standard continetal breakfast stuff. The Lido itself was nice, more peaceful than Venice, although we didn't spend much time there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Value + Great Location”
Reviews.Author: a786374534
Reviews.Content: Now, keep in mind that we paid $59/night including taxes for this so we are super-happy. Very good location in Lido - 15 min by waterbus to St Marco square in Venice. Good breakfast. Relatively quiet. Rooms had good decor and were a bit smallish, but so what? - this is Europe, not Texas :-) The staff was friendly and stored out luggage for the whole day on the date of departure. Overall, awesome value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy!”
Reviews.Author: LudmillaMontreal
Reviews.Content: I'm so happy that we booked a room at this hotel! Our room was spacious, modern and clean. Even though we decided not to book a lagoon view, we got a lovely room with a good view onto the street and a balcony. The breakfast was very good. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It's literally across the street from the vaporetto station, but it took about an hour for us to get there from the Ferrovia station. There is a faster vaporetto(number 52) but it doesn't come as often.

Reviews.Title: “If you like staff with bad attitude, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Gav31
Reviews.Content: It's not often I stay in a hotel and wish for the stay to end, but this definately was one of those occasions. First the good points .... excellent location, right in the centre of Lido and very close for transportation into Venice. Excellent views over the Lagoon towards St. Marks .... alhtough you have to pay an additional 20 euros per night for the privelege! Now the bad points ..... the daytime front desk staff were terrible, rude and very dismissive. I was astounded at the expressions and faciciousness that one in particular exhibited towards me (the nightime staff was great, no problems there!). Room 21 was tired, had mould on the bathroom ceiling, small tv/no remote, no internet access and the wallpaper was hanging off. A water pipe even runs along the roof! Overall the room was very dated and if it were not for the view, we would have left. The internet access is 6 euros an hour, which is the most expensive I have seen anywhere. In summary, the arrogance of the daytime front desk staff and the dated tired room ruined any chance of a reasonable stay at this hotel and I would certainly not return here. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good position”
Reviews.Author: keenvisitor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently situated at the end of the main street and directly across from the vaporetto stop. The sign is easy to miss as it is not large. Like many hotels in Venice (it seems) it is looking a little faded. We booked a room with a lagoon view and a balcony (they ignored the request for the rate offered by the conference we were attending, on booking, on arrival and the next day, with differing excuses). The room (20) was large (so was the furniture - I could not reach the hanging rack in the wardrobe) and the view spectacular. The bathroom had a window and a bath! The balcony was quite small but the french doors enabled you to sit and enjoy the view. It was very hot and sticky so we were glad of the A\C at night. So far so good. The breakfast was the usual, meats, boiled eggs etc. but the plastic cups for the watery juice were a bit tacky and the coffee was not great. We used the internet but thought that 6 euros an hour was a bit steep.On the morning of the 5th day we reported that the toilet was not working properly. When we returned several hours later it was still not right and eventually their plumber decided it was broken and removed it so we had to change rooms. No help was offered and the second room (39) was much smaller. It still had the view but only if you stood right at the window and there was no balcony. There were rugs on the floor which slid whenever you stepped on them (we rolled them up before one of us fell) and there was an 8 inch step up into the tiny bathroom (no window and a very small shower). The TV was high up in the corner and you could only see it comfortably if you were lying on the bed. Even taking the humidity into account we thought the sheets felt damp. When we asked for a discount for the last night their English suddenly desserted them (as, by then , we expected) and they thought we should just be glad they had a room to give us (we didn"t remove the toilet!!!). All in all this was the worst of the 3 hotels we have stopped in at the Lido and at 240euros a night it was the most expensive. Taking into account that this was the first week of high season we thought this hotel was bad value for the money. I would not reccommend this hotel mainly because of the bad attitude of the daytime front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: sconroy26
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in May of 2008, we were booked here through our tour group. Overall we had a great time and thought the hotel was very nice. The rooms are small (even for Europe), but the staff was very helpful and the hotel was very clean. The hotel is a small, family run and very charming. The location is right across the street from a vaporetto stop, so St. Marks is a short boat ride away. There is a great cafÃ© across the street and just down the main street are several wonderful restaurants. What really made our stay great was the view from the room, we had a 4th floor room that overlooked the lagoon with St. Marks in the background, was great to come back to the room after a long day and drink wine while watching the sun set. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a relaxing few days in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised at the Riviera”
Reviews.Author: JoJo1Buffalo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riviera for 3 nights in Oct. 07 as part of a Go Ahead tour and found the hotel to be wonderful. It was very clean. Our room was like a mini-suite and very large by European standards. It is located on Lido Island and it is a great location to chill out after the crowds in Venice. Many wonderful little places to eat and shop.

Reviews.Title: “great position”
Reviews.Author: noshy
Reviews.Content: stayed here three nights Sept 12th 2007. opposite the bus station so noisy early, but greta for the boats to Venice, wonderful views of Venice from the boats. clean and pleasant. Simple but fine for 3 nights

Reviews.Title: “Noisy - But otherwise Great”
Reviews.Author: vickypnotts
Reviews.Content: Myself and my Mum stayed here about 2 weeks ago for 5 nights. Hotel was lovely, staff were friendly and the breakfast was ok. This hotel is absolutely fantastic value for money, and when booking I requested a lagoon view, and thats what we got. We loved the lido, which is 10 mins from Venice and the Hotel was opposite the boat stop. Staying on the Lido is a lovely way to see Venice, as it is more of a Holiday place with a small beach, and a peaceful atmosphere about it. Eating and drinking in Venice is highly expensive, so most of the time we found nice restauraunts on Lido, and bars that would serve into the early hours. **** Only downside to this Hotel - was the Cleaners. If you want a lie in.... Do not stay here. At 9 in the morning they are shouting, banging, and trying to get into your room while you are still in bed and the key is in the door! And if they realise you are still in your room, it becomes more noisy so that you'll get up. They clean your room every day, so it was something that I found very annoying after five nights. Noise outside the room cannot be helped and if the shutters and windows were closed it is not a problem. Otherwise The Riviera Hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the lido”
Reviews.Author: karching
Reviews.Content: Staying on the lido was really nice. It is a little bit of paradise in Venice. The hotel was nice, the room was really nice and comfortable, we got a nice view from our window, the staff were really nice which were the doormen, counter staff, breakfast attendants and also the cleaners! The only reason I am rating this a three and not a five is because there was no fridge and it was a little noisy. I found the noise a problem from within the establishment. We were situated next to the elevator and also noisy teenage tour group stayed right next to our room. They banged on walls and ran through the hallway laughing and screaming all hours of the morning. If it wasnt for these two things I would rate it a 5. Definately a nice hotel, very welcoming and a really nice area to venture in. I would stay there again if going to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend this”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette132
Reviews.Content: Myself and 6 friends had booked this hotel for 3 nights in May. I could not fault this hotel at all. Its not 5 star quality - but doesnt pretend to be either. What you do get is a charming hotel with friendly, helpful staff who really want to make your stay happy. The decoration was originally opulent but is slightly jaded and this just adds to the charm of the place. Extremely clean with maid service daily. There is a lovely terrace overlooking the lagoon where you could enjoy a glass of wine and chat with friends as the sun goes down - excellent and 'just what the doctor ordered'. We didnt pay extra for lagoon views but got them anyway and it was just excellent throwing open the shutters and seeing that wonderful view. Although the hotel really is just by the varporetto stop, one recommendation would be to pay for a water taxi to take you there from the coach park (particularly if you have travelled from Treviso). What could be better than arriving, via the Grand Canal, on your own private launch! We will definitely go there again and I will take my husband and daughter at a later date as they will love it too. If you have any doubts about staying here - dont, you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and value!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisGreenwood
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Riviera for four nights from 1 Jun 2007 on a long weekend break with friends. We wanted a hotel which had easy access to the city but which provided a break from the hustle and bustle. From the moment we entered the Riviera we knew we had made the right choice. Straight across the road from the vaporetto stop yet very little noise got through the well fitting windows. The rooms were not the largest we have had but were very well thought out and had all the required elements. They were spotlessly clean on arrival and attended to each day with fresh towels in the shower-room. Breakfast was the standard european breakfast but with individual pots of fresh coffee delivered with a cheery "Buongiorno!" Access to the city was just so easy with a 15 minute ride across to St Mark's Square; so easy that we went back for an evening to sample Venice by night which gave us a completely different perspective on the city. There are several good value restaurants within 200 yards of the Riviera - our favourite was opposite the petrol station - which seems an odd choice of location - where we could sit outside and watch the sun set over the city and see pleasure boats being refueled from a standard petrol pump with the longest hoses we've seen! Hot chocolate to finish the meal was an interesting change from coffee and gave our waiter a good laugh. On our check out morning we had to catch the Alilaguna ferry back to the airport at 7:41 and breakfast did not start until 7:30, no problem - there was a packed snack bag with fruit juice, fruit, croissants, cheese and biscuits ready for each couple as we sorted ou the bill! The reception staff were always very helpful and didn't mind our attempts at Italian even when it came out as Spanish! All in all this was a very nice place to stay and we will certainly be using it again and recommending it to any of our friends who wants a good value, convenient hotel for a visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Love Riviera Hotel”
Reviews.Author: love2travel1818
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 1 night in Venice on a week long Italy trip. We decided to stay at the Riviera based on user reviews and were so glad we did. The hotel is easy to find, in a good location, clean, spacious and friendly! We arrived via the train station and getting on the boat to get to Lido was a bit of a hassle. We were crammed in like cattle and people were pushing and shoving. If we had to do it over again we would have payed the money for the water taxi. Once we got to Lido however the hotel was very easy to find. It is right across from the water taxi stand. The lobby was beautiful and the staff was very friendly. They took us up to our room and it was a pleasant surprise. We had a small balcony and a large tub. We stayed in room #38. Our friends stayed in #60 and although it was just as clean, there was no balcony and their bathroom was small. Just a small stand up shower. So if you go ask for room #38 or one with a balcony! Breakfast was good, hard boiled egges, coldcuts and various breads and cereals. The cappuccino was fantastic! The only thing to keep in mind is that to get to St. Marks (the main island where the gondolas and major shops are) it takes about 30-40 minutes by water taxi so make sure to leave yourselves plenty of time. We took a gondola ride at 100euro which seemed a bit expensive but was well worth the money. We went around 7pm (right before the price goes up) and it was fantastic. Still light enouhg to see everything but not too hot. Overall this was a great hotel and I would stay there again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good to escape to”
Reviews.Author: CJG82
Reviews.Content: This is a pleasant, quiet hotel situated off the main island. Like most of Venice this establishment caters mainly for the older person of an American/British persuasion rather than an Italian guest and as a result it is slightly old fashioned and faux traditional. Breakfast is served in an eating area with table service for coffee and tea. The food itself is buffet and is soft cheese, salami and ham with bread and croissants and yoghurt and fruit. The main disappointment was the orange juice, which appeared to be made from squash and was certainly not fresh. The room I stayed in was very small as was the bathroom but it was very clean and was always made up even if we slept through their first attempt to get in. We paid extra for the lagoon view which isn't really worth the money unless you can get a balcony as you'll tend to keep the shutters closed to keep out the heat anyway. Unless you plan to spend time in your room working or watching TV there is nothing here to complain about. Being on Lido has definite advantages: you are close to the beach, the tourist population is significantly lower than in Venice proper and food and drink is also cheaper. You are dependant on vaporetto to get to the main island which is about 10 minutes to St. Mark's, at least double that to get to the Rialto. Water buses run regularly in the day and (less often) throughout the night, a water taxi is ~â‚¬50 from St. Mark's. Reception and service is of a high standard. Very polite and helpful, arranging for a shirt and suit to be pressed at very short notice and good recommendations for cafes and restaurants. Didn't batter an eyelid at a couple of very late returns to the hotel (the majority of Venice shuts at 11) and generally added to our stay. We certainly enjoyed our stay here but may consider staying on the main island for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: tlartist
Reviews.Content: In general, I look for value in a hotel. The value was very good at the Riviera Hotel. Reasons to stay at the Riviera Hotel: 1) good price for Venice (I paid 90 euro), 2) clean, well maintained rooms, 3) friendly staff, 4) internet access just off the lobby, 5) location away from Venice core (nice to have some peace at the end of the day), 6) could go to the beach, on the other side of the Lido after about a 15 minute walk, 7) convenient to water transport to Venice and other locations. Reasons not to stay at the Riviera Hotel: 1) if you are noise sensitive there is activity until about 10AM each night, after that pretty quiet. I stayed by myself 3/31/07 - 4/3/07. I originally planned to stay 1 day but extended to 3 because I liked the hotel and wanted a little vacation in the middle of my vacation. The location on the Lido, and access to the beach, was very nice. Just great to take a break and get some sun and quiet time. Really no problem having to take water transport. Kind of neat being able to ride the boats and see the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended Hotel Riviera, Lido Venezia”
Reviews.Author: JMOP1
Reviews.Content: We booked the Riviera Hotel on the internet and were very Pleased with the choice. Excellent location for transport to Venice, other islands on the Lagoon and the Airport. As the Vaporetto water bus station is opposite the hotel, there is some noise but this presented no problem. We booked a room with a view of the Lagoon across to St. Mark's Piazza and we were not disappointed. The view at any time of the day was amazing and added much to our stay in the Riviera Hotel. The staff were excellent and were most helpful at all times. Room was always cleaned and any request was met immediately. The Lido itself is a great location from which to explore all the islands on the Lagoon. We hired bicycles one of the days and enjoyed the sightseeing around the Lido itself, which lends itself to cycling as it is mainly flat. The no.1 Vaporetto is a must to St. Mark's Square and indeed the Grand Canal. Thr Riviera Hotel is ideally situated for all exploration. Definitely recommended and would definitely stay there again. Pleased travellers from Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: wyldedixie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were guests at this hotel from 03/17/07 to 03/22/07. First of all, given the difficulties I had in locating a local web address for this hotel, I will provide it here should you need to contact the hotel directly before your stay. It is ---. We were impressed with our room and the hotel in general. The staff speaks English fluently, and they were courteous as well as professional. Internet access is available in the hotel, but you do have to use it in the lobby due to the wireless router's location in the hotel. It will not reach above the first floor. Internet access is not free. Although the location is not as convenient as staying on the main island of Venice right on the Grand Canal, we enjoyed staying on Lido. We were a 10-minute vaporetto (waterbus) ride away from St. Mark's Square whenever we wanted to be there. Lido is much more quiet and residential than Venice itself. The beauty of Hotel Riviera was that we were able to shop at the local grocery store for lunch a couple of times, eat at restaurants locals patronized, and we had a post office within a 5-minute walk of us. Our room was spacious and provided all of the typical amenities of a hotel: hairdryer, in-room safe, storage space, etc. The hotel is right across the street from the vaporetto stops, so it's quite convenient to get back to Venice quickly. Housekeeping is excellent. I came back to the room one evening to discover that it had been tidied up so well that my pajamas had been placed under my pillow. That was excellent service. The bed was a double, but it was actually two singles placed together to make a double. An extra blanket was provided, but we did not find extra pillows. There was a desk for writing in the room. The lighting was excellent with three lamps and a chandelier. From our room, we could see the lagoon. We could open the windows to get fresh air anytime we needed it. That was wonderful. The bathroom featured a deep tub and shower with a removable head. The vanity/sink area had shelving so that you could place your toiletries in a convenient location. The bathroom also featured a bidet. We were quite pleased with our experience here, and we would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Find!!”
Reviews.Author: Newton66
Reviews.Content: The Riviera Hotel and the whole of the Lido is like stepping back in time. Both are a fabulous secret that not many people know about and I hope they never will!! Both are clean, safe and extremely welcoming!! I would urge anybody to go and enjoy it for themselves - but not too many mind!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: cay112
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved this hotel. It has a great location on Lido and the vaporetto stop across the street was convenient and easy to use. We found Lido to be a quiet treat away from the hustle and bustle of Venezia. The hotel restaurant featured a standard European breakfast that was a nice way to start each day. We also loved the mushroom risotto! We hope to return to Venice someday and stay at the Hotel Riviera again!
